result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Court ordered Justice Point monitoring to Level 4.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Cash bail remains as previously set.  Court granted defense motion to modify Justice Point monitoring to Level 4.

Defendant Marquis Montrel Washington in court.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Marquis Montrel Washington.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. Discussion as to possible joinder with defendant's other case.  State to consider joinder. Case adjourned for final pretrial and for jury trial in Branch 37.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 4, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

JusticePoint PreTrial Services Status Report dated October 4, 2022; received and filed.
Missed Office Contact. 
Defendant made-up contact.

Defendant Marquis Montrel Washington in court.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Marquis Montrel Washington.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer Juliana Nailen. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 37 and remains calendared for 10/18/2022 at 1:30pm.
Parties are advised that due to the defendants lower pending matter 19CF1063 this matter will be re-assigned to Br. 37 Judge Dee.

Defendant Marquis Montrel Washington not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Case is set for preliminary hearing.  State's witness is present. SPD did not appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marquis Montrel Washington in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Marquis Montrel Washington in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marquis Montrel Washington appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2, 3 and 4.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
